posts.title: Alpha 1.0 Now Accessible
posts.content:
I’m pleased to share that the Alpha 1.0 version of Mr-Prince.com is now live and accessible to all.
This early version marks a first step, and I’m inviting you to explore, test, and share any feedback you might have.

The Alpha phase is a chance to understand what works and what doesn’t, to improve the site with your input.
Whether you come across any issues, have ideas, or just want to share your experience,
your feedback will be invaluable in shaping the platform.

If you have questions or would like to reach out, feel free to contact me on X (@MrPrinceYL) or by email at youssef68@web.de.

Thank you for taking part in this early stage.
posts.html_content:
I’m pleased to share that the Alpha 1.0 version of Mr-Prince.com is now live and accessible to all.
This early version marks a first step, and I’m inviting you to explore, test, and share any feedback you might have.

The Alpha phase is a chance to understand what works and what doesn’t, to improve the site with your input.
Whether you come across any issues, have ideas, or just want to share your experience,
your feedback will be invaluable in shaping the platform.

If you have questions or would like to reach out, feel free to contact me on X (@MrPrinceYL) or by email at youssef68@web.de.

Thank you for taking part in this early stage.
posts.author: MrPrinceYL

posts.title: Reclaiming the Internet: A Tribute to the Lost Web
posts.content:
Welcome to Mr-Prince.com, a digital sanctuary that stands in stark opposition to the rapid modernization of the internet.
Our mission is simple: to resist the cookie-cutter designs and soulless mobile optimization that dominate today's web.We believe that the web has lost much of its character, personality, and charm. The internet we once knew,
filled with unique designs and personal touches, is rapidly being replaced by sterile, standardized experiences.

Mobile views—optimized for small screens—are an abomination in our eyes.
It's a trend that strips websites of their originality and individuality.
At Mr-Prince.com, we reject this idea, holding on to the nostalgia of the early 2000s when the internet was a chaotic,
yet beautifully personal place.

Our design is a tribute to the websites of the late 2000s, and in some ways, a rebellion against the modern internet.
We intentionally embrace the aesthetic and quirks of that time, bringing back a sense of fun and
freedom that has been lost to corporate-driven, mobile-first approaches.

"The more we use the internet, the more we become afraid of people who are not like us, and the more we build walls around ourselves." -Jaron Lanier


According to the "Dead Internet Theory", which we believe is no longer just a theory but a sad truth,
much of the internet has become automated, homogenized, and devoid of real human influence.
Since 2019, this theory has become a reality, and we at Mr-Prince.com are here to push back,
offering an alternative space where the internet still has personality, diversity, and life.
This website serves as a counterpoint to the modern web, a digital space where nostalgia and rebellion meet.

History of the Internet
Information Age
Dead Internet Theory
Nostalgia

posts.title: Strangers of the Internet: Friendships and Risks in the Digital Age
posts.riddle_warning:
The following post on the topic "Strangers of the Internet" is locked because it contains private and sensitive personal information
that should not be visible to everyone.
If you are a close friend of the admin of this page, you can unlock this post by correctly answering the following riddle:
posts.riddle_content:
I’m black and have known the admin well,
Since November 2016, our story we tell.
My last name rhymes with a treat quite sweet,
“Vanilla-Riegel” sounds like my surname neat.

Who am I, what’s my first name, do you say?
A clue awaits, it’s just a guess away!
